required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Comparing the Tolerability of Seroquel IR With Seroquel XR in Patients With Bipolar Depression
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase IV, Multi-center, Double-blind, Double-dummy, Randomized, Parallel-group Study to Compare the Tolerability of Quetiapine Fumarate Immediate Release (Seroquel IR) With Quetiapine Fumarate Extended Release (Seroquel XR) During Initial Dose Escalation in Patients With Bipolar Depression

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to compare the sedation profile one hour after dose administration between Seroquel IR and Seroquel XR.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Modified Bond-Lader Visual Analog Scale Score After 50-mg Dose (Day 2)
primary_outcome.description: The Modified Bond-Lader Visual Analog Scale (VAS) uses a 100 mm line, each with a set of opposing adjectives at either end:Alert (=0) - Drowsy (=100); If patient is sleeping the Bond-Lader VAS will be assign a score of 100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Modified Bond-Lader Visual Analog Scale Score After 100-mg Dose (Day 3)
secondary_outcome.description: The Modified Bond-Lader Visual Analog Scale (VAS) uses a 100 mm line, each with a set of opposing adjectives at either end:Alert (=0) - Drowsy (=100); If patient is sleeping the Bond-Lader VAS will be assign a score of 100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Modified Bond-Lader Visual Analog Scale Score After 200-mg Dose (Day 4)
secondary_outcome.description: The Modified Bond-Lader Visual Analog Scale (VAS) uses a 100 mm line, each with a set of opposing adjectives at either end:Alert (=0) - Drowsy (=100); If patient is sleeping the Bond-Lader VAS will be assign a score of 100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Modified Bond-Lader Visual Analog Scale Score After 300-mg Dose (Day 5)
secondary_outcome.description: The Modified Bond-Lader Visual Analog Scale (VAS) uses a 100 mm line, each with a set of opposing adjectives at either end:Alert (=0) - Drowsy (=100); If patient is sleeping the Bond-Lader VAS will be assign a score of 100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Modified Bond-Lader Visual Analog Scale Score After 300-mg Dose (Day 6)
secondary_outcome.description: The Modified Bond-Lader Visual Analog Scale (VAS) uses a 100 mm line, each with a set of opposing adjectives at either end:Alert (=0) - Drowsy (=100); If patient is sleeping the Bond-Lader VAS will be assign a score of 100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Intensity Modified Bond-Lader Visual Analog Scale Score
secondary_outcome.description: The Maximum Intensity Modified Bond-Lader VAS after dose (MaxIntVAS) is calculated as maximum possible value of VAS during that day at any from 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 12, 13, 14 hours post-dose assessments

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Maximum Intensity Modified Bond-Lader Visual Analog Scale Score
secondary_outcome.description: Time (Tmax) to Maximum Intensity Modified Bond-Lader VAS after dose is corresponding assessment time (one from 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 12, 13, 14 hours post-dose) of MaxIntVas

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Modified Bond-Lader Visual Analog Scale-time Curve
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the Modified Bond-Lader VAS-time curve is calculated by the linear trapezoidal formula which equals sum of (Ck+Ck+1)/2 multiplied by the time interval between k and k+1 observations, where Ck and Ck+1 are the corresponding the intensity of sedation evaluations measured by the Modified Bond-Lader VAS from 1 to 14 hours post-dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Simpson-Angus Scale (SAS) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: SAS total score is the sum of the 10 individual-item scores (range:0-40), with the score for each item ranging from 0 to 4, higher scores indicate greater severity of Parkinsonian symptoms. Change : total score at day 7 minus total score at randomization. Increase in Change of total score indicates an increase in extrapyramidal motor symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Barnes Akathisia Rating Scale (BARS) Global Score
secondary_outcome.description: BARS global score is the 4th individual-item score on the BARS scale,the Global Assessment of Akathisia, with the score ranging from 0 to 5. Change : score at day 7 minus score at randomization. Increase in Change of BARS global score indicates an increase in akathisia.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale (AIMS) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: AIMS total score is the sum of the 10 individual-item scores (range:0-40), with the score for each item ranging from 0 to 4. Change : total score at day 7 minus total score at randomization. Increase in Change of total score indicates an increase in abnormal voluntary movements.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Potential Extrapyramidal Symptoms (EPS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of the study treatment to last dose plus 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with adverse events potentially associated with EPS collected by MedDRA Preferred Terms as akathisia, extrapyramidal disorder, restlessness

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Potential Somnolence
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of the study treatment to last dose plus 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with adverse events potentially associated with somnolence collected by MedDRA Preferred Terms as lethargy, sedation, somnolence

intervention.description: Oral, 3 tablets daily: (2 x 25 mg + 1 x 50 mg) at one time each day
Oral, 3 tablets daily: (2 x 25 mg + 1 x 50 mg) at one time each day

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- DSM-IV-TR documented bipolar I or bipolar II, most recent episode depressed
- Outpatient status as enrollment
Exclusion Criteria:
- Other than bipolar disorder under study, patients must not have another current, major disorder that is symptomatic or has required treatment within 6 months of enrollment.

responsible_party.name_title: Hans Eriksson, MD, Medical Science Sr Director

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A 7-day, inpatient, multicenter, double-blind, double-dummy, randomized, parallel group, Phase IV study was done to compare the tolerability of quetiapine IR with quetiapine XR during initial dose escalation in patients with bipolar depression. In total 139 patients were randomized in 15 centers in the USA between June and August 2009.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Patients must have DSM-IV-TR documented bipolar I or bipolar II, most recent episode depressed, and outpatient status at enrollment . Patients must not have another current, major disorder that is symptomatic or has required treatment within 6 months of enrollment.

outcome.title: Modified Bond-Lader Visual Analog Scale Score After 50-mg Dose (Day 2)
outcome.description: The Modified Bond-Lader Visual Analog Scale (VAS) uses a 100 mm line, each with a set of opposing adjectives at either end:Alert (=0) – Drowsy (=100); If patient is sleeping the Bond-Lader VAS will be assign a score of 100.
outcome.population: The modified intent-to-treat (MITT) analysis data set included all randomized patients who received study treatment, classified according to their randomized treatment and provided the Modified Bond-Lader VAS score at baseline (pre-dose at Day 1 or Day 2) and at least 1 hour after 50 mg dose administration.

outcome.population: The modified intent-to-treat (MITT) analysis data set included all randomized patients who received study treatment, classified according to their randomized treatment and provided the Modified Bond-Lader VAS score at baseline (pre-dose at Day 1 or Day 2) and at least 1 hour after 50 mg dose administration.

measure.description: Time (Tmax) to Maximum Intensity Modified Bond-Lader VAS after dose is corresponding assessment time (one from 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 12, 13, 14 hours post-dose) of MaxIntVas

outcome.title: Area Under the Modified Bond-Lader Visual Analog Scale-time Curve
outcome.description: Area under the Modified Bond-Lader VAS-time curve is calculated by the linear trapezoidal formula which equals sum of (Ck+Ck+1)/2 multiplied by the time interval between k and k+1 observations, where Ck and Ck+1 are the corresponding the intensity of sedation evaluations measured by the Modified Bond-Lader VAS from 1 to 14 hours post-dose
outcome.population: The randomized safety analysis data set included all patients who received at 1 dose of randomized study treatment during the Randomized treatment Phase, classified according to actual treatment taken.

measure.title: Area Under the Modified Bond-Lader Visual Analog Scale-time Curve
measure.description: Area under the Modified Bond-Lader VAS-time curve is calculated by the linear trapezoidal formula which equals sum of (Ck+Ck+1)/2 multiplied by the time interval between k and k+1 observations, where Ck and Ck+1 are the corresponding the intensity of sedation evaluations measured by the Modified Bond-Lader VAS from 1 to 14 hours post-dose
measure.population: The randomized safety analysis data set included all patients who received at 1 dose of randomized study treatment during the Randomized treatment Phase, classified according to actual treatment taken.

outcome.title: Change in Simpson-Angus Scale (SAS) Total Score
outcome.description: SAS total score is the sum of the 10 individual-item scores (range:0-40), with the score for each item ranging from 0 to 4, higher scores indicate greater severity of Parkinsonian symptoms. Change : total score at day 7 minus total score at randomization. Increase in Change of total score indicates an increase in extrapyramidal motor symptoms.
outcome.population: The randomized safety analysis data set included all patients who received at 1 dose of randomized study treatment during the Randomized treatment Phase, classified according to actual treatment taken.

outcome.population: The randomized safety analysis data set included all patients who received at 1 dose of randomized study treatment during the Randomized treatment Phase, classified according to actual treatment taken.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The PI agrees to collaborate in good faith with AstraZeneca with regards to the contents and formation of any publication or disclosure to be made by the PI and to pay due consideration to the comments, views and opinions offered by AstraZeneca
